result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:40 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Douglas J Obrien in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Douglas J Obrien.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff provides an update; he is still waiting on discovery and an offer.  Atty. Wolff is asking that the matter be set for plea and sentencing in about 30 days.  State advises there is an offer in the file and will route that to Atty. Wolff today, he will have to route the file to the ADA assigned to make sure discovery is provided.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:49 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Douglas J Obrien in court.  Attorney Brandon Carlson for attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Douglas J Obrien. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Repayment at the rate of $35.00 per month commencing October 1, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:03 AM Defendant Douglas J Obrien in court.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant. Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $35.00 per month commencing October 1, 2022. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A WAGE ASSIGNMENT.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim time limits.
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

MINUTES UPDATED 8/22/22 AT 10:32 AM.
The Court will allow the Defendant to pay directly to the business center every month.  Should the Defendant miss one payment a wage assignment will then go into place.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

9:53 AM Defendant Douglas J Obrien in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant will proceed without counsel. 
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
